p.s: The first step to any successful business is promotion and marketing , and the second follow-up step is retention .
To learn how to bring in and keep customers can be challenging if you have never been exposed to marketing or public relations .
By following a few easy steps , however , you should be able to not only boost business but keep it steady and/or growing as well .

item.s: Start with noticeable and recognizable signage .
You want your drive-by traffic to know who you are and what your business does .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 1.jpg

item.s: Make any day an excuse for an event .
Be it a sale , an anniversary , or an open house , celebrate by promoting an event and opening your doors to the general public .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 2.jpg

item.s: Offer an incentive to visit or refer your business .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 3.jpg

item.s: Run a time-sensitive sale or special to drive in traffic .
Offer a referral incentive for those who refer new customers your way .
Consider print advertising such as the newspaper , magazine , or ads or listings in the phone book .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 4.jpg

item.s: Devote time and energy in a website and in maintaining a social networking page for your business .
Both of these tools can be low cost and offer you means to keep your name in front of the crowd electronically .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 5.jpg

item.s: Think about radio or television ads .
Radio works wonderfully for event-driven exposure , and television can help you build brand recognition .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 6.jpg

item.s: Network with local professional organizations to build a referral system for year-round leads .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 7.jpg

item.s: Work to keep the customer base that you have built .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 8.jpg

item.s: Start with quality customer service .
Be polite and respectful to everyone who comes in your door , and treat that person as you would want to be treated .
Train your staff not only how to be polite but how to successfully do their jobs as well .
Being nice does n't sell your product , nor does it help your staff avoid mistakes .
Instead , that comes with good training and practice .
With their permission , sign your customers up for your mailing or email list .
You can do this in the store or on your website .

figure.rend: Bring In and Keep Customers Step 9.jpg

item.s: Institute a best practices methodology that includes not selling or sharing the customers ' information with anyone outside of your business .
Make sure that this policy is shared on your website for full transparency .
Follow up with emails to join your Facebook page , send a copy of an online newsletter or send emails about upcoming sales or special events .
You want to keep your clients engaged in what is going on at your business , but on the other side be sure not to inundate them .
Mail out fliers , hard copy coupons or newsletters if the printing and mailing costs are affordable for you .
Always include an opt-out option so that customers do n't feel like they are stuck getting your correspondence if they do n't really want to .
Try to boost your search engine status by embedding pertinent tags into your web pages .
You should also link your home page to the majority of the pages on your site .
